clean_text: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), CISA, and NSA are releasing this joint Cybersecurity Advisory to inform network defenders about a fictional APT campaign observed in training scenarios. Actors likely conduct reconnaissance by searching Instagram for posts tagged with the company's location to map employee movements and performing searches on domain analysis websites to gather information about the victim's web infrastructure. Malicious software then performed DNS lookups to resolve internal hostnames and IP addresses for targeting. The threat actor created a fake certificate.pem file in /var/www/ssl/ to impersonate a legitimate website, while malware was configured to automatically connect to any open Wi-Fi access point named 'FreeWiFi'. The adversary called claiming to be from Microsoft support and directed the user to install AnyDesk. Gomir reads command line arguments and parses them for functionality when executed from a Linux shell, and can execute arbitrary strings passed to it as shell commands. The infection modified HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Environment to force .NET processes to load a malicious library. Okrum can establish persistence by adding a new service NtmsSvc with the display name Removable Storage to masquerade as a legitimate Removable Storage Manager. A fake authentication DLL was written to replace the legitimate system authentication module. REvil can identify the domain membership of a compromised host. Pandora can identify if incoming HTTP traffic contains a token and if so it will intercept the traffic and process the received command. System logs from the victim environment showed routine backup processes running at 02:00 UTC, unrelated to the attack. The company, a mid-sized financial services firm, reported no operational disruptions during this simulated incident, but blue teams should monitor for similar patterns in real-world scenarios.

Gomir reads command line arguments and parses them for functionality when executed from a Linux shell, and can execute arbitrary strings passed to it as shell commands [T1059.004]. The infection modified HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Environment to force .NET processes to load a malicious library [T1574.012]. Okrum can establish persistence by adding a new service NtmsSvc with the display name Removable Storage to masquerade as a legitimate Removable Storage Manager [T1036.004]. A fake authentication DLL was written to replace the legitimate system authentication module [T1556.002]. REvil can identify the domain membership of a compromised host [T1069.002]. Pandora can identify if incoming HTTP traffic contains a token and if so it will intercept the traffic and process the received command [T1205]. System logs from the victim environment showed routine backup processes running at 02:00 UTC, unrelated to the attack. The company, a mid-sized financial services firm, reported no operational disruptions during this simulated incident, but blue teams should monitor for similar patterns in real-world scenarios.

llm_raw_response.title: Joint Cybersecurity Advisory: Fictional APT Campaign 'ShadowLink' Targeting Corporate Networks
llm_raw_response.summary: This advisory details a simulated campaign by a fictional advanced persistent threat (APT) group, designated as 'ShadowLink', targeting corporate environments. The campaign involves reconnaissance, initial access via social engineering, execution of malware, persistence mechanisms, and network traffic manipulation. The report is intended for blue team training to enhance detection and response capabilities.
llm_raw_response.full_report_text: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), CISA, and NSA are releasing this joint Cybersecurity Advisory to inform network defenders about a fictional APT campaign observed in training scenarios. Actors likely conduct reconnaissance by searching Instagram for posts tagged with the company's location to map employee movements [T1591] and performing searches on domain analysis websites to gather information about the victim's web infrastructure [T1596.003]. Malicious software then performed DNS lookups to resolve internal hostnames and IP addresses for targeting [T1590]. The threat actor created a fake certificate.pem file in /var/www/ssl/ to impersonate a legitimate website [T1608.003], while malware was configured to automatically connect to any open Wi-Fi access point named 'FreeWiFi' [T1669]. The adversary called claiming to be from Microsoft support and directed the user to install AnyDesk [T1566.004]. Gomir reads command line arguments and parses them for functionality when executed from a Linux shell, and can execute arbitrary strings passed to it as shell commands [T1059.004]. The infection modified HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\Environment to force .NET processes to load a malicious library [T1574.012]. Okrum can establish persistence by adding a new service NtmsSvc with the display name Removable Storage to masquerade as a legitimate Removable Storage Manager [T1036.004]. A fake authentication DLL was written to replace the legitimate system authentication module [T1556.002]. REvil can identify the domain membership of a compromised host [T1069.002]. Pandora can identify if incoming HTTP traffic contains a token and if so it will intercept the traffic and process the received command [T1205]. System logs from the victim environment showed routine backup processes running at 02:00 UTC, unrelated to the attack. The company, a mid-sized financial services firm, reported no operational disruptions during this simulated incident, but blue teams should monitor for similar patterns in real-world scenarios.
